intro: Pharus lappulaceus, commonly known as the slender sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is a low-growing, mat-forming perennial that typically thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or white, blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and fleshy, adapted to conserve water in dry conditions. Pharus lappulaceus is often found in sandy or gravelly soils, making it a characteristic species of steppe and desert regions.
